text: Brickellia aramberrana is a Mexican species of flowering plants in the daisy family. It is native to the state of Nuevo León in northeastern Mexico.Turner, B. L. 1997. The Comps of Mexico: A systematic account of the family Asteraceae, vol. 1 – Eupatorieae. Phytologia Memoirs 11: i–iv, 1–272 Brickellia aramberrana is a branching shrub up to 150 cm (60 inches) tall. The plant produces several small flower heads with yellow disc florets but no ray florets.Turner, Billie Lee 1993. Phytologia 75(2): 140-142 diagnosis in Latin, description and commentary in English, photo of type specimen on page 141 The species is named for the community of Aramberri, near where the species was initially discovered. ==References== aramberrana Category:Flora of Nuevo León Category:Plants described in 1993
title: Brickellia aramberrana
